title: Enhancing Customer Experience Practical Competencies: Mathematical Problem-Solving Utilizing Cognitive Load Theory and the Zeigarnik Effect

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and problem-solving experience
context.additional_context: Customer service competency enhancement program for service/customer-facing role practitioners

learning_goals: Learners can explain complex mathematical problem-solving processes with over 80% accuracy by applying trace-based learning.
Learners reduce cognitive load by over 30% and improve problem-solving accuracy through trace activities with eyes open/closed.

Over one week, learners will develop three self-directed learning strategies utilizing the spacing effect (Spaced Repetition) in a project-based learning environment, apply them to two real work scenarios, and achieve ≥80% peer evaluation satisfaction.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
